talk.author: did:plc:fchra352da5q57ej4swiebii
talk.utter: You're still doing exactly what she is describing: victim blaming. There is communication. One party is lying.

talk.author: did:plc:z6zxpiaeshcgg47slprjanmq
talk.utter:
Perhaps we should bring back those old Christian ideas of courtship, where we meet one another intellectually and emotionally, without a sexual expectation? 

Maybe that would be better, less lies, less baby-killing. Placing the blame wholly on any one group is wrong. Celibacy is the way. God Bless!

talk.author: did:plc:fchra352da5q57ej4swiebii
talk.utter: Christian ideas of courtship do not prevent men from lying. The only difference back then was that women were trapped and could not leave when they discovered the truth.

talk.author: did:plc:fchra352da5q57ej4swiebii
talk.utter:
Christian men don't want women to be celibate. They still want women to have sex with them. They just want them to suffer for doing it.

Women deciding not to have date, have sex, get married, or get pregnant, breaks the system. Those women aren't suffering.

talk.author: did:plc:z6zxpiaeshcgg47slprjanmq
talk.utter:
Christian men that fail their own ideals. How we treat one another is sad. We should be building one another up in dignity, in commitments to Love realized. We should all do better then.

It doesn't break the system, the world will go on, and it's a sad rebellion that only divides people. God Bless.

100% it is personal safety and that's why it applies across the political spectrum. 

The men who take it most personally are our allies who fail to see that it's for our safety. They insist we're "punishing" them even though they behaved, which ironically reveals just how entitled they are.
